examples: I looked about at the scenery that surrounded me.

definitions.definition: Here and there ; around; in one place and another; up and down.
examples: Bits of old machinery were lying about .

definitions.definition: From one place or position to another in succession; indicating repeated movement or activity .
examples: walking about ;  rushing about ;  jumping about ;  thrashing about
messing about ;   fooling about ;  loafing about

definitions.definition: Nearly; approximately ; with close correspondence in quality, manner, degree, quantity, or time; almost .
examples: It’s about as cold as it was last winter.
He owes me about three hundred dollars.
I was so scared, I about fainted.
I’ll see you at about 4 o'clock.

definitions.definition: To a reversed order; half round; facing in the opposite direction; from a contrary point of view.
examples: to face about ;  to turn oneself about

subdefinitions.definition: To the opposite tack : see go about .
examples: We went about and headed offshore.

definitions.definition: In succession ; one after another; in the course of events.
In circuit; circularly ; by a circuitous way; around the outside; in circumference .
examples: The island was a mile about , and a third of a mile across.

secondary_definitions: Here and there ; around; in one place and another; up and down. [from before 1150 ]
From one place or position to another in succession; indicating repeated movement or activity .
Nearly; approximately ; with close correspondence in quality, manner, degree, quantity, or time; almost . [from before 1150 ]
To a reversed order; half round; facing in the opposite direction; from a contrary point of view. [from ca. 1350–1470 ]
( obsolete or rare ) In succession ; one after another; in the course of events. [from before 1150 ]
( archaic ) In circuit; circularly ; by a circuitous way; around the outside; in circumference . [from ca. 1350–1470 ]
